intro: Elatostematoides robusta, commonly known as the robust liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its dense, carpet-like growth habit and is typically found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a thalloid structure composed of a leafy stem and closely packed, ribbon-like leaves. Elatostematoides robusta reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. It plays an important ecological role in maintaining soil moisture and providing habitat for microorganisms.
